refined_topic: How Do Airplanes Fly Through the Sky?
learning_objectives: Understand the concept of lift and how wings create it
Learn about the four forces of flight: lift, weight, thrust, and drag
Discover the basic parts of an airplane and their functions
Explore the history of human flight from the Wright Brothers to modern jets
key_points: Wings are curved on top and flat on bottom, creating different air pressures
Engines push air backward, which pushes the plane forward (Newton's Third Law)
Pilots use controls to steer the plane up, down, left, and right
Airplanes need a long runway to build up enough speed for takeoff
Modern airplanes can fly thousands of miles and carry hundreds of passengers
The Wright Brothers made the first powered flight in 1903
Air traffic controllers help keep planes safe in the sky
